UnitType.Backstory: An Imp is a portion of a channeler's magic given form and life. Some channelers use them as messengers, others as spies. Do not mistake them for mere summons, the channelers power can reach out through them as easily as his voice or sight.

The Blink Dog is a rarely sighted magical canine that possess a unique ability to teleport short distances. They are intelligent, making loyal companions and allies. Although a peaceful creature they are quick to defend themselves when threatened.

Wargs are fell creatures, wolves mutated by dark magics thousands of years ago. They are stronger and more cunning than their non-magical counterparts. They prefer to hunt alone, and will fight over territory rather than ally themselves with their brethren.
Wind Wargs do not have the same propensity for violence as most Wargs, although they as dangerous as any. They are quick and evasive, possessing unnatural reaction times.

No serpent hates men as much as these, for the Naja were bred within N'it'Vaganesh as living weapons. They can grow to three times a man's length, with fangs as long and sharp as short swords.
The River Naja is not venomous, however it has a strong bite and an unnaturally fast attack.

GameItemType.Description: This plate cuirass is clearly the work of a master armorsmith. Its plates have been layered to provide it with additional resistance to impact.

UnitType.Backstory: The Celestial Defender is the line soldier of the Celestial Heavens, a devoted guardian of all that is good.

GameItemType.Description: Blessed robes that protect the wearer.

UnitType.Backstory:
Angels are a race of celestial beings, humanoid in appearance with feathered wings. They act as attendants and messengers to the greater Gods.
Angels of Light are the lowest in rank and power of heavenly angels, serving the role of guardians and protectors in the war against evil.

GameItemType.Description: Unholy robes that protect the wearer.
An elegant but deadly longsword.

UnitType.Backstory:
Angels are a race of celestial beings, humanoid in appearance with feathered wings. They act as attendants and messengers to the greater Gods.
Dark Angels are one of the more common Angels, evil assassins who find pleasure in battle and death.

Pack Drakes are to the Great Drakes as those creatures are to Dragons; smaller, less powerful, but still unwise to underestimate. Though Pack Drakes do possess an animal cunning, they lack the savage intelligence of their greater cousins. They behave, rather, like wolves, forming territorial packs that defend their territory.
The rarer "Storm" Pack Drake tends to be larger than the common Pack Drake, and can release a charge of static energy, causing lightning damage to adjacent opponents.

These shrills are said to be constructs made by Morrigan the Mad, in the laboratories of N'it'Vaganesh - his attempts to manufacture monsters to rival the giant spiders that the Titan Curgen kept at his beck and call.
The Crag shrill is larger and more dangerous thost most forms of shrill.

The Inferno Spider is one of many strange perversions of nature that appeared after the Cataclysm. They are a large wicked arachnid, possessing an extraordinary abdomen that constantly smolders in flame. The Inferno Spider does not use a web or poison but can evoke a burst of flame that engulfs surrounding enemies.

The Sea Skath is one of the largest and most intelligent of the Skath species. Sea Skaths take advantage of the easy meals provided by the nets of careless fisherman. Many fishing vessels have been overturned by these beasts, who never pass at the chance to dine on the floundering crew.
Skath Fins are rare indeed and can be sold to merchants for a hefty amount of gildar.

These great cats are solitary hunters, with an uncanny ability to target the weakest member within any group - be it wolf pack, trading caravan, or fighting army - and make a quick kill of them. Recall Erwynn's tale of the Princess's Pet, and the fate of Duke Prandir, who was chased across the deserts of Lombard to his death.
The Dire Boar is a particularly wild and ferocious strain of wild boar... so dark and feral that some believe they are cursed with the spirit of a demon.
Archons are powerful elementals serving in the armies of the forces of good. These celestial beings are unrelenting in their battle evil.

UnitType.Quote: I feed on death and blood.
UnitType.Backstory:
It was Curgen's brother, the Drednir known as Kir-Tion, who first summoned these creatures (known variously as Drednii, or Demons) to Elemental. Upon the very altar where Josryn the Elder received Great Ereog's blessing, Kir-Tion first bound and then sacrificed the Princess Lansa to open a portal to the outer planes... and through that portal came these monsters and their brethren (it should be noted that there are some channelers who believe that the Drednii are simply death magic made flesh, and not separate, sentient creatures). All demons draw their strength from devouring the life-force of other beings.
The horns of these creatures are often used in various alchemical remedies and magical experiments, and are extremely valuable.

Sometimes called tree-kin, the reclusive forest guardians are generally peaceful creatures. They generally do not stray far from their forest homes, preferably not to get involved with the affairs of others. When disturbed however, or if their beloved forests are threatened, they can be quick to anger and will readily go to battle.

Sometimes called tree-kin, the reclusive forest guardians are generally peaceful creatures. They generally do not stray far from their forest homes, preferably not to get involved with the affairs of others. When disturbed however, or if their beloved forests are threatened, they can be quick to anger and will readily go to battle.

Sometimes called tree-kin, the reclusive forest guardians are generally peaceful creatures. They generally do not stray far from their forest homes, preferably not to get involved with the affairs of others. When disturbed however, or if their beloved forests are threatened, they can be quick to anger and will readily go to battle.

GameItemType.Description: A cuirass made from molded and hardened leather. The hardened leather feels reinforced by magical means, providing the resistance of metal even though it is lighter than normal leather.
This warhammer crackles with lightning and the sound of thunder crashes each time it strikes an opponent.

GameModifier.Provides: Hits like thunder - Has a chance equal to 2 x damage done of knocking the victim prone
Crushing Blow- +100% Attack, but you lose your next action

UnitType.Backstory: The proud warrior Storm Giants can be found in the highest mountaints. They can harness the electrical energy from the air to call lightning bolts upon their enemies.

UnitType.Quote: When the earth rises, you would do well to fear...
UnitType.Backstory:
The creatures known as Crag Spawn appear to be a variety of Earth Elemental; less powerful but more prone to violence than their larger cousins. They hate men, especially miners, and are fond of collapsing mines by destroying the tunnel braces. They then use the miners' picks and hammers to pull bones out of the trapped miners in a gross parody of the miners' work. For these reasons, some have speculated that these creatures were created by Morrigan, or his allies among the Fallen.
The Crag Lord is the largest of the Crag Spawn.

GameItemType.Description: The torn sword is a vicious weapon that can slice through limbs with ease.

UnitType.Backstory: The Cacus Giant is a fearsome giant with the innate ability to invoke a devastating burst of fire. Found in mountainous and volcanic regions, they are fortunately rarely encountered.

GameItemType.Description: A deadly sharp spear, it's magic enhances the wielders accuracy and evasion.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

UnitType.Backstory: Oceanborn are tall amphibious humanoids. These "water giants" are now such a rare sight that they are in fact believed to be a creature of folklore.
The Windwalkers ability to control the winds can be invaluable assitance to an army.
The Flame Spawn is a walking inferno - it knows only to burn.
The Undine are powerful water spirits - mythical beings that guarded lakes, pools and waterfalls.

GameItemType.Description: This pike of the heavens unleashes divine lightning with every attack but helps protect its wielder from the lightning attacks of others.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them

UnitType.Backstory: Angels are a race of celestial beings, humanoid in appearance with feathered wings. They act as attendants and messengers to the greater Gods.

GameItemType.Description: This infernal pike heals the wielder when it wounds.

GameModifier.Provides: Impale- Strike an opponent and whoever is behind them
Unit heals 6 Hit Point whenever they damage an opponent with a melee attack

GameItemType.Description: A cuirass forged from abyssal steel and enchanted with protective wards.

UnitType.Backstory: Angels are a race of celestial beings, humanoid in appearance with feathered wings. They act as attendants and messengers to the greater Gods.

GameItemType.Description: Well... it's for killing stuff.

GameModifier.Provides: Backswing- If the attack misses the unit gets a second attack against the same target
Unit heals 1 Hit Point whenever he damages an opponent with a melee attack
Increases the amount healed from damaging an opponent from 1 to 6

UnitType.Backstory: Angels are a race of celestial beings, humanoid in appearance with feathered wings. They act as attendants and messengers to the greater Gods.

GameItemType.Description: This plate cuirass is clearly the work of a master armorsmith. Its plates have been layered to provide it with additional resistance to impact.
A design of armlets from a time long forgotten. They are a marvel of efficiency, providing unrivaled protection while remaining lighter than similar armor.

GameItemTypeModel.ModelFile: gfx/hkb/items/armor/kingdom armor/kingdom elite armor export A/kingdom_elite_vambrace_A.hkb
gfx/hkb/items/armor/kingdom armor/kingdom elite armor export A/kingdom_elite_vambrace_A.hkb

GameItemType.Description: These boots have been carefully crafted by a master armorsmith. The delicate carvings on them belie their true purpose, to provide the utmost protection.

GameModifier.Provides: +1 Dodge vs Ranged Attacks per Level

GameItemType.Description: This is no ordinary weapon, rather a relic - a mighty weapon that belongs in the hands of an Angel.

GameModifier.Provides: Bash- Has a chance equal to the damage done of knocking the victim prone
Crushing Blow- +100% Attack, but you lose your next action

UnitType.Backstory: Angels are a race of celestial beings, humanoid in appearance with feathered wings. They act as attendants and messengers to the greater Gods.
Angels are a race of celestial beings, humanoid in appearance with feathered wings. They act as attendants and messengers to the greater Gods.

GameItemType.Description: This axe smoulders with an internal fire, but when its handle is gripped the blade bursts into flame.

GameModifier.Provides: Backswing- If the attack misses the unit gets a second attack against the same target

UnitType.Backstory: Angels are a race of celestial beings, humanoid in appearance with feathered wings. They act as attendants and messengers to the greater Gods.

GameItemType.Description: This shield has been adorned with magical glyphs to help ward the bearer from enemy spells.

GameModifier.Provides: Shield Bash- Knocks the victim back a tile

UnitType.Backstory: Angels are a race of celestial beings, humanoid in appearance with feathered wings. They act as attendants and messengers to the greater Gods.

UnitType.Quote: To feel my touch is to feel no more.

Upon the very altar where Josryn the Elder received Great Ereog's blessing, Kir-Tion first bound and then sacrificed the Princess Lansa to open a portal to the outer planes... and through that portal came these monsters and their brethren (it should be noted that there are some channelers who believe that the Drednii are simply death magic made flesh, and not separate, sentient creatures). All demons draw their strength from devouring the life-force of other beings.
Their horns are often used in various alchemical remedies and magical experiments, and are extremely valuable.

GameItemType.Description: Armor of the Heavens.

GameModifier.Provides: +5 Defense vs Undead unless user is Undead
+5 Defense vs Demons unless user is Demon

GameItemType.Description: This sword was not forged in this world, it is a divine weapon not intended to be wield by mortals.

UnitType.Backstory: Angels are a race of celestial beings, humanoid in appearance with feathered wings. They act as attendants and messengers to the greater Gods.

GameItemType.Description: Torch Archon Armor

UnitType.Backstory: It was Curgen's brother, the Drednir known as Kir-Tion, who first summoned these creatures (known variously as Drednii, or Demons) to Elemental. Upon the very altar where Josryn the Elder received Great Ereog's blessing, Kir-Tion first bound and then sacrificed the Princess Lansa to open a portal to the outer planes... and through that portal came these monsters and their brethren (it should be noted that there are some channelers who believe that the Drednii are simply death magic made flesh, and not separate, sentient creatures). All demons draw their strength from devouring the life-force of other beings.
The Spirit Wolf is a celestial guardian that is known to assist lost or endangered adventurers and travellers.

It was Curgen's brother, the Drednir known as Kir-Tion, who first summoned these creatures (known variously as Drednii, or Demons) to Elemental. Upon the very altar where Josryn the Elder received Great Ereog's blessing, Kir-Tion first bound and then sacrificed the Princess Lansa to open a portal to the outer planes... and through that portal came these monsters and their brethren (it should be noted that there are some channelers who believe that the Drednii are simply death magic made flesh, and not separate, sentient creatures). All demons draw their strength from devouring the life-force of other beings.
The Bane Wyrm heralds the coming of darkness, as it is often found at the vanguard of a Drednii legion.

Within the third quarto of the Varis Reliquaria is contained the spell Anima Tsal Animana - life from lifelessness. This incantation, first mastered by Ereog in his time of solitude, imbues stone with the semblance of life, creating creatures that have come to be known as golems.
The simpler golems are controlled by the channeler who creates them, and will return to an inert state if the Channeler is killed or is otherwise unable to maintain control.
When a Golem is destroyed, it reverts back to the normal rock it was prior to enchantment.

In desperate times greater archons have been known to take possession of an elemental being, combining the power of the elemental with the archon's divine might. The process is dangerous and in most circumstances, cannot be undone.

GameItemType.Description: A wicked blade for a wicked creature

GameModifier.Provides: Units struck have their defense reduced by 50% for 5 turns

UnitType.Backstory:
It was Curgen's brother, the Drednir known as Kir-Tion, who first summoned these creatures (known variously as Drednii, or Demons) to Elemental. Upon the very altar where Josryn the Elder received Great Ereog's blessing, Kir-Tion first bound and then sacrificed the Princess Lansa to open a portal to the outer planes... and through that portal came these monsters and their brethren (it should be noted that there are some channelers who believe that the Drednii are simply death magic made flesh, and not separate, sentient creatures). All demons draw their strength from devouring the life-force of other beings.
"Hazu Bah'kehga" is it's drednii name, "Defiler" as known to men... this infernal creature leads the armies of darkness into battle.
Beware, the demonic beach ball of doom that is the Abhorrent Dretch.
